intro: Verbesina leucactinota, commonly known as the white-veined beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, alternate leaves with prominent white veins, and its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in open woodlands. The species is known for its hairy stems and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
